Fitness and suitability of the example code for any use within Licensee’s applications need to be verified by Licensee on its own authority by taking appropriate state of the art actions and measures (e.g. by means of quality assurance measures). Licensee shall be responsible for conducting the development of its applications as well as integration of parts of the example code into such applications, taking into account the state of the art of technology and any statutory regulations and provisions applicable for such applications. Compliance with the functional system requirements and testing there of (including validation of information/data security aspects and functional safety) and release shall be solely incumbent upon Licensee. For the avoidance of doubt, Licensee shall be responsible and fully liable for the applications and any distribution of such applications into the market.

Macro used to define the SPI Baudrate
Macro used to define the data transfer timeout

briefdescription.para: Generic function to send and receive data over SPI.

detaileddescription.para: RETCODE_OK on success, or an error code otherwise. Refer function prototype for description

briefdescription.para: Function to print Device ID, PAC and Lib info.
Function to print chip SOC Version.
This will enable the Sigfox communication. It wakes up the chip and prepares it for further communication exchange.
Send getInfo command to SOC OL2385 to get ID and PAC and lib version.
Retrieve device & software version of OL2385 chip.
Print Downlink Payload.
Read PA Curve. Only subcommands 0-ReadETSIPATable and 3-ReadFCCPATable are supported.
Reset Macrochannel (for RCZ2 and RCZ4 only)
Send sigfox empty frame.
Send sigfox payload.
Send Innocomm chipset to sleep mode.
Send wakeup command to SOC OL2385. Should be used before sending a payload as SOC goes in sleep mode automatically.

Set FCC Macrochannel. config_words[0] are for Channels 1 to 32 (902.2MHz to 911.5MHz) config_words[1] are for Channels 33 to 64 (911.8MHz to 921.1MHz) config_words[2] are for Channels 65 to 86 (921.4MHz to 927.7MHz)
Set AES Private Key (default mode)
Set AES Public Key (to use with SNEK)
Set Radio Zone 1 (ETSI)
Set Radio Zone 2.
Set Radio Zone 3.
Set Radio Zone 4.
This will setup the Sigfox communication by initializing the SPI interface with the chip and allocating the necessary buffers for memory.
Update PA Curve. Only subcommands 1-UpdateETSIPATable and 4-UpdateFCCPATable are supported PA Curves tables are hardcoded in Sigfox.c file.
